body:
... ok so I tried a new (test) project from scratch with a much shorter video, to exclude errors resulting from porting between machines and file size etc... I labeled on my laptop (Ubuntu 20.04) and ported everything to the remote machine (Ubuntu 18.04 LTS) BEFORE creating a training set. After getting around several GPU and training issues I ended up with a similiar error:
Code output

```python `deeplabcut.evaluate_multianimal_crossvalidate(config_path, Shuffles=[1], edgewisecondition=True, ...: leastbpts=1, init_points=20, n_iter=50) /home/daniel/dlc-project/PoC-daniel-2020-11-01/evaluation-results/iteration-0/PoCNov1-trainset95shuffle1 already exists! Finding argmax of the acquisition function. ~/miniconda3/envs/DLC-GPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sklearn/gaussian_process/_gpr.py in fit(self, X, y) 232 optima = [(self._constrained_optimization(obj_func, 233 self.kernel_.theta, --> 234 self.kernel_.bounds))] 235 236 # Additional runs are performed from log-uniform chosen initial ~/miniconda3/envs/DLC-GPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sklearn/gaussian_process/_gpr.py in _constrained_optimization(self, obj_func, initial_theta, bounds) 501 opt_res = scipy.optimize.minimize( 502 obj_func, initial_theta, method="L-BFGS-B", jac=True, --> 503 bounds=bounds) 504 _check_optimize_result("lbfgs", opt_res) 505 theta_opt, func_min = opt_res.x, opt_res.fun ~/miniconda3/envs/DLC-GPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/scipy/optimize/_minimize.py in minimize(fun, x0, args, method, jac, hess, hessp, bounds, constraints, tol, callback, options) 616 elif meth == 'l-bfgs-b': 617 return _minimize_lbfgsb(fun, x0, args, jac, bounds, --> 618 callback=callback, **options) 619 elif meth == 'tnc': 620 return _minimize_tnc(fun, x0, args, jac, bounds, callback=callback, ~/miniconda3/envs/DLC-GPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/scipy/optimize/lbfgsb.py in _minimize_lbfgsb(fun, x0, args, jac, bounds, disp, maxcor, ftol, gtol, eps, maxfun, maxiter, iprint, callback, maxls, finite_diff_rel_step, **unknown_options) 306 sf = _prepare_scalar_function(fun, x0, jac=jac, args=args, epsilon=eps, 307 bounds=new_bounds, --> 308 finite_diff_rel_step=finite_diff_rel_step) 309 310 func_and_grad = sf.fun_and_grad ~/miniconda3/envs/DLC-GPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/scipy/optimize/optimize.py in _prepare_scalar_function(fun, x0, jac, args, bounds, epsilon, finite_diff_rel_step, hess) 260 # calculation reduces overall function evaluations. 261 sf = ScalarFunction(fun, x0, args, grad, hess, --> 262 finite_diff_rel_step, bounds, epsilon=epsilon) 263 264 return sf ~/miniconda3/envs/DLC-GPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/scipy/optimize/_differentiable_functions.py in __init__(self, fun, x0, args, grad, hess, finite_diff_rel_step, finite_diff_bounds, epsilon) 74 75 self._update_fun_impl = update_fun ---> 76 self._update_fun() 77 78 # Gradient evaluation ~/miniconda3/envs/DLC-GPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/scipy/optimize/_differentiable_functions.py in _update_fun(self) 164 def _update_fun(self): 165 if not self.f_updated: --> 166 self._update_fun_impl() 167 self.f_updated = True 168 ~/miniconda3/envs/DLC-GPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/scipy/optimize/_differentiable_functions.py in update_fun() 71 72 def update_fun(): ---> 73 self.f = fun_wrapped(self.x) 74 75 self._update_fun_impl = update_fun ~/miniconda3/envs/DLC-GPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/scipy/optimize/_differentiable_functions.py in fun_wrapped(x) 68 def fun_wrapped(x): 69 self.nfev += 1 ---> 70 return fun(x, *args) 71 72 def update_fun(): ~/miniconda3/envs/DLC-GPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/scipy/optimize/optimize.py in __call__(self, x, *args) 72 def __call__(self, x, *args): 73 """ returns the the function value """ ---> 74 self._compute_if_needed(x, *args) 75 return self._value 76 ~/miniconda3/envs/DLC-GPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/scipy/optimize/optimize.py in _compute_if_needed(self, x, *args) 66 if not np.all(x == self.x) or self._value is None or self.jac is None: 67 self.x = np.asarray(x).copy() ---> 68 fg = self.fun(x, *args) 69 self.jac = fg[1] 70 self._value = fg[0] ~/miniconda3/envs/DLC-GPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sklearn/gaussian_process/_gpr.py in obj_func(theta, eval_gradient) 223 if eval_gradient: 224 lml, grad = self.log_marginal_likelihood( --> 225 theta, eval_gradient=True, clone_kernel=False) 226 return -lml, -grad 227 else: ~/miniconda3/envs/DLC-GPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sklearn/gaussian_process/_gpr.py in log_marginal_likelihood(self, theta, eval_gradient, clone_kernel) 474 y_train = y_train[:, np.newaxis] 475 --> 476 alpha = cho_solve((L, True), y_train) # Line 3 477 478 # Compute log-likelihood (compare line 7) ~/miniconda3/envs/DLC-GPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/scipy/linalg/decomp_cholesky.py in cho_solve(c_and_lower, b, overwrite_b, check_finite) 192 (c, lower) = c_and_lower 193 if check_finite: --> 194 b1 = asarray_chkfinite(b) 195 c = asarray_chkfinite(c) 196 else: ~/miniconda3/envs/DLC-GPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/numpy/lib/function_base.py in asarray_chkfinite(a, dtype, order) 496 if a.dtype.char in typecodes['AllFloat'] and not np.isfinite(a).all(): 497 raise ValueError( --> 498 "array must not contain infs or NaNs") 499 return a 500 ValueError: array must not contain infs or NaNs` ```

@AlexEMG @jeylau it would be great if you'd take a look! <3

Hi @rasdani - can you tell me how a full.mp4 video looks, i.e. if you run video analysis on a test video? and how do the scoreamps, etc look - i.e., how does the pose estimation part look from the pipeline?

Hi @MMathisLab , I appreciate you taking the time!

The labels in the video created with .create_video_with_all_detections look fine and plausible, the scoremaps etc., too.
Would be nice if we could get X-Validation running, but for preliminary analysis the tracking performance looks good enough.
However now I'm stuck at the refine tracklets part in the pipeline. When I fire up the GUI only the labels for the static objects (markers in the corner of a stimulus display) are recognized (sometimes not even that) but when I advance in the timeline to the point, where individuals are visible there are no labels shown and therefore no tracklets to refine. 
Is this due to long intermittent periods (trial breaks), where no individuals appear in the source video?
I attached screenshots from the video, the scoremaps, and the tracklet GUI.
Besides the GUI is laggy as hell.

Greetings and thanks for the support!

![Bildschirmfoto von 2020-11-22 18-34-45](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73563550/99910968-972d4900-2cf1-11eb-8ebb-7cfbbfb86b33.png)
![img07868_locref_train_1_0 95_snapshot-50000](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73563550/99911012-da87b780-2cf1-11eb-9437-6021877e80a8.png)
![img07868_paf_train_1_0 95_snapshot-50000](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73563550/99911017-de1b3e80-2cf1-11eb-8354-087fad4e56c3.png)
![Bildschirmfoto von 2020-11-22 18-42-18](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73563550/99911107-7adddc00-2cf2-11eb-8292-a1965bcf4ab1.png)

can you update to 2.1.9; this includes some updates to the 2.2beta code; should be faster too. But, without x-val, your `inference_cfg.yaml` file could be way off -- it's really required for tracking. Can you post what you have for that? I can try to give some tips for the values ... (it's under dlc-models > interation-X > ..shufflex > test)

issue.title: ValueError: array must not contain infs or NaNs

labels.name: WORK IN PROGRESS!
labels.description: developers are currently working on this feature... stay tuned.

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
OS: Windows 10
DeepLabCut Version: '2.2b8'
Anaconda env used: conda 4.8.5

I am having a problem getting any evaluation results at all. I was able to get through entire process for another video but am having an issue reproducing results on another video. I had a similar error earlier but changing the max iterations to 20,000 as suggested in the documents worked for me. But that has not worked this time.  
I have also faced the same error while trying to implement on other new videos. Im not sure if its related to loss convergence? But it seems to have converged based on the iteration that worked for me. 
Thanks for your help in advance! 

TERMINAL OUTPUT:

```python

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. I had already labelled frames.  So i restarted anaconda to see if I could get rid of the error. 
2. Evaluate Network
3. See error

body:
I'll try rerunning the pipeline with 2.1.9 later.
Here's my inference_cfg.yaml:

```yaml
addlikelihoods: 0.15
averagescore: 0.1
boundingboxslack: 0
detectionthresholdsquare: 0.1
distnormalization: 1000
distnormalizationLOWER: 0
iou_threshold: 0.2
lowerbound_factor: 0.5
max_age: 100
method: m1
min_hits: 3
minimalnumberofconnections: 3
pafthreshold: 0.1
topktoretain: 3
upperbound_factor: 1.25
variant: 0
withid: false

Reran the x-val on the remote machine and the tracklet GUI on my laptop with 2.1.9, still no luck (and the GUI speeds up only a little, still quite laggy even with tracing points set to 0).
I am now writing my own little script to parse the ...full.pickle file in order to retrieve raw label coordinates to do my preliminary analysis. Have to keep moving somehow.

Have a nice day!
your x-val looks way off, that is why it is so slow, btw!

Thanks for your assessment!
But why does my ...full.mp4 look ok though? 
And could you suggest some values for the parameters so that I could finish the tracklet step?
Actually I'm not that interested in tracking, more in the label coordinates to put them into relation to eye tracking data.
Is refining tracklets that important or can I skip this step somehow in the pipeline?

Since someone asked on [https://forum.image.sc/t/using-the-full-pickle-file/44403](url) I figured I might post it here as well.
Here's my really ugly script to parse the _full.pickle file:

[https://github.com/rasdani/bachelor-thesis/blob/main/get_detections.py](url)

I might brush it up sometime.
Cheers!

P.S. Got any news on my x-val problem?

your problem is related to the data, and how you likely defined your skeleton. Firstly, I do not see why you cast this as a multi-animal problem. You can run single animal DLC on this perfectly. Your "humans" never cross. I would re-do the project, personally. The second part is too few body parts/ and not enough connections for animal assembly. As we explain in the docs, you need more points, and you need a fully connected skeleton to train on. Without this, this is no reason to use a bottom-up approach for this. But again ,you don't need tracking. Just run out of the beta code (normal mode), and you will be fine!

Sure will do that!

Thanks a lot!  :+1:
